descriptionSet.description: In this image, Bhimrao Ramji Ambedkar, an Indian politician, jurist, philosopher and lawyer can be seen in three different depictions: In the centre he is depicted alone. On the upper right corner he is seen handing over the constitution to the first prime minister of India, Jawaharlal Nehru. In the lower right corner, he is seen in front of a statue of Buddha. At the bottom of the image the Indian parliament in New Delhi can be seen.

inscription.text: I go to the Buddha for refuge

description-en: In this image, Bhimrao Ramji Ambedkar, an Indian politician, jurist, philosopher and lawyer can be seen in three different depictions: In the centre he is depicted alone. On the upper right corner he is seen handing over the constitution to the first prime minister of India, Jawaharlal Nehru. In the lower right corner, he is seen in front of a statue of Buddha. At the bottom of the image the Indian parliament in New Delhi can be seen. (sp)
text-en: 2296 - Dr. Ambedkar
text-en: Publishers - Associated Calendars, 26, Karuppanan St., Sivakasi-626 123 (Phone: 394)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: Babasaheb Ambedkar as he later came to be known as is famous for his role in drafting the Indian constitution and his commitment and loyalty to the untouchable caste. He also converted to Buddhism and was referred to as a Bodhisattva by some Indian Buddhists. He is shown handing over the constitution because of his pivotal role in drafting it. (sp)
